data.title: Carillon Historical Park, Historic Site in Dayton, OH
data.meta_description: Carillon Historical Park in Dayton, Ohio is a 65-acre campus that showcases the region's industrial innovations and transportation achievements. Founded by Colonel Edward Deeds and his wife Edith, the park features numerous buildings and artifacts that highlight Dayton's contributions to the world, including inventions like the airplane and the cash register. The park offers a variety of events and activities, including free concerts, a Christmas Spectacular musical performance, and A Carillon Christmas. Visitors can also enjoy attractions like a hand-carved carousel, a 4-D theater, and living history experiences. Carillon Historical Park is open year-round, except for certain holidays, and offers free parking.
